page.title: 05PUBLIC HEALTH IN CROSTON
page.content: This is administered by the {Environmental Health}Officer in Chorley. All except 4 isolated farms are on mains water. Most dwellings have main sewer connections, although there is a septic tank emptying service. Refuse is collected weekly. There is no local tip, but private skips can be hired.Streets are cleaned both by machine and by manual labour. {HEALTH CARE IN CROSTON} There are{2 doctors}plus{health {visitors and district nurses.}The nearest hospitals are Chorley, Ormskirk, Preston and Southport.{The {chemist}serves about 70 people per day.Most popular pills are painkillers and antibiotics. In summer the main complaint is hay fever and in winter it is bronchitis or rheumatism. Infant deaths are rare and life expectancy is 75 years.
